titleStmt.title: Nicholas Callan to Nathaniel Gaither, Jr.
CWG2832

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p:
Washington City D C
11th June 1862
N Gaither Esqr. Sec of State
Dear Sir

I have to express my deep regret that in consequence of absence from home and my numerous engagements that I overlooked until this morning that it was my duty to send you the fee required by law for my commission as commissioner of deeds for Kentucky I now enclose a check for the amount $5. which I regard to be a more safe way of remitting than to send a Bank note I presume any of your Banks will give the cash for the check, I also send a certificate that I have taken the usual oath of office with a copy of my official seal

Dist Columbia
Oath
N. Callan
Comr. of Deeds
Filed June 16. 1862
